item.title: Gadget mode on raspberry pi
item.description: Gadget mode enables a raspberry pi to be connected and controlled by a computer with only a usb cable Flash raspberry pi os(the full or lite version) on an SD card and modify the following in the boot folder: in config.txt add dtoverlay=dwc2 at the end of the file in cmdline.txt add modules-load=dwc2,g_ether after rootwait word create a file name ssh (without extension) You should be able to connect to the pi now:

item.title: Leave no plant behind
item.description: This project is meant to keep my plants healthy while I go on vacations. Parts required raspberry pi zero (will work with any raspberry pi) micro usb power supply 3v-5v pump small hose for the pump 5v relay wires Wiring diagram Relay inputs: NO = normally opened NC = normally closed CO = common DC- = ground DC+ = 5V signal IN = signal Code Simple python code to send a signal to pin 8 for 0.

item.title: SSH key-based auth
item.description: Generate a public/private key pair and ssh-keygen # add `~/.ssh/pi_rsa` when prompted for which file to save the key Move the public key to the raspberry pi ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/pi_rsa.pub pi@raspberrypi.local SSH into the raspberry pi ssh pi@raspberrypi.local
